instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3462: What is 820-3462? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1534: What is A1534? A1534 is a model number for a 12 inch size Macbook  from years 2015, 2016 with EMC 2746, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00045, 820-00244..
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No brain
threads.message: Clean board that turns on, USB has power but not activity, known good screen gets lid up but no image, this to me is a no brainer :LOL:

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No brain
threads.message:
One of the worst Apple boards; before <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> came out.

Any history available, previous work on it in other place?
All voltages present, including VCORE?

What about <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>?
If present, you can try new BIOS file.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No brain
threads.message:
No prior repairs by the looks of the board.

VCORE present.

<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is present, will try new BIOS if I can find one
